text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
I cannot understand why Ali should serve in that moribund administration.
explanation:
"Moribund" means something in a state of decline or near death, and "crumbling" best fits this meaning.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The conference Centre caters for transients only.
explanation:
"Transients" refers to people who stay temporarily, so "temporary guest" is the nearest in meaning.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The coalescence of the groups created additional problems.
explanation:
"Coalescence" is the coming together or union of different groups, so the nearest meaning is "union."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
As the triumphant rebels were returning to their base they met with a serious reverse.
explanation:
"A serious reverse" refers to a setback or defeat after a period of success. Therefore, the rebels met with a serious defeat.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The village girl wore sumptuous clothes.
explanation:
"Sumptuous" means rich, luxurious and expensive, so the clothes the village girl wore would be described as expensive.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Any chief executive of an organisation would find radical changes blocked at every turn.
explanation:
"Radical changes" refers to new or innovative ideas that can be difficult to implement, so "innovations" is the most fitting choice.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Ugo has often been described as belligerent.
explanation:
"Belligerent" means aggressive or combative, so "combative" is the nearest in meaning.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The men were tardy in offering help.
explanation:
tardy means ineffectual, slow-witted, slow to act. These adjectives mean not arriving, occurring, acting, or done at the scheduled, expected, or usual time:tardy in making a dental appointment; late for the plane; an overdue bus.
Synonyms:tardy, late, overdueSynonyms:tardy, late, overdue
Antonym:prompt
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Funmi is just being facetious about her marrying a soldier.
explanation:
Facetious means treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humour or being flippant. It suggests that someone is not being serious. This means that "unserious" is the answer to this question.
Crazy means being mentally unstable or wild. Serious is the opposite of facetious. Unfaithful means being disloyal, particularly in a romantic relationship.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The professor discussed a number of abstruse topics.
explanation:
"Abstruse" refers to something difficult to understand or obscure. "Esoteric" also refers to something understood by only a small, specialised group, making it the nearest in meaning.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Bose was angry because her friend called her pilferer.
explanation:
A "pilferer" is someone who steals in small amounts. Therefore, the word closest in meaning to "pilferer" is "thief."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
While the hooligans exchanged blows, we looked complacently.
explanation:
"Complacently" means being self-satisfied or content. It is closest in meaning to "contentedly," which means in a state of happiness or satisfaction.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Tade became timorous when she was asked to give the valedictory speech.
explanation:
"Timorous" means fearful or shy, which is nearest in meaning to feeling nervous.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
The player kept on gamely to the end of the match.
explanation:
"Gamely" refers to showing determination or courage, particularly in difficult situations, which matches the meaning of "courageously."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option nearest in meaning to the word underlined.
Art lies in cherishing the initiative and creative power of each person.
explanation:
This is because "initiative and creative power" refers to an individual's inherent ability or capacity to create or innovate.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. 
Oche's chief idiosyncrasy is a passion for pounded yam.

options.C: Oche has a penchant for pounded yam

explanation:
The sentence suggests that Oche has a strong liking or preference for pounded yam.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. 
You must not attend the end-of-year party.

options.A: It is not necessary that you attend the party
options.B: It is necessary that you do not attend the party
options.C: You do not have to decide whether to attend the party or not
options.D: You have to decide whether to attend the party or not

explanation:
''You must not attend the end-of-year party''This statement means that it is compulsory to abstain from the party. This means that it is necessary that you do not go to the party.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. 
The man reasoned that there ought to be a limit to sycophancy.

options.A: there can be no favour beyond a reasonable point
options.B: sycophants need not talk all the time
options.C: people should know when not to use flattery
options.D: sycophants should know when to grant people's requests

explanation:
The sentence means that sycophancy (excessive flattery or praise) should not be taken to an extreme and that there should be a reasonable limit to it.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. 
Adawo is an imp.
explanation:
The term "imp" is someone who behaves mischievously or badly.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence. 
The solution lies in choosing between various negative alternatives.

options.A: the solution can be found in one of negative options
options.B: the solution lies in choosing between the positive and the negative
options.D: the solution is a negative one

explanation:
The phrase"choosing between various negative alternatives"means that all options are negative and the solution requires picking one of these undesirable options.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Identify the word that has the stress on the first syllable.
explanation:
stress is the degree of force applied when pronouncung the syllable(s) of a word. the stress syllable is the syllable on which the speaker uses more muscular energy and breath effort when pronouncing a word. we have various degrees of stress patterns such as, primary stress, secondary stress, tertiary stress and weakly stressed.
bisyllabic (two syllable) words are usually stressed on the first syllable except the first syllable is a prefix.  example (DOCtor) is stressed on the first syllable but ''disprove'' is stressed on the second syllable because the first is a prefix, so it becomes (disPROVE). in the above question, all the options but ''saloon'' have a prefix. that means saloon has its stress on the first syllable.
Note however that, there are certain exceptions to the above rule when the word is either a ''çompound noun''or a ''compound verb''
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
The lecture seemed interminable.
explanation:
The word"interminable"means something that seems endless or very long. The opposite would be short or brief.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
Had I known about their plan much earlier I would have nipped it in the bud.
explanation:
The phrase"nipped it in the bud"means stopping something before it develops further. The opposite of this would beallowing it to grow or supporting itrather than just starting it."Promoted it"(D) means tosupport, encourage or help something develop.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
What a harmless thought he has.
explanation:
The word"harmless"means something that is safe or not likely to cause harm. The opposite would is something dangerous or harmful (pernicious)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
The town was all agog at his unexpected return.
explanation:
The word"agog"means eager, excited or in a state of high anticipation. The opposite is a lack of excitement.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
In his naivety he believed all the stories his friend told him
explanation:
"Incredulity" means scepticism or disbelief, which is the opposite of naivety or believing everything without question.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
The journalist's write-up contained a plethora of detail.
explanation:
The word"plethora"means an excessive or abundant amount of something. The opposite would imply ashortageor scarcity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
Amina's performance in the examination surpassed my expectations.
explanation:
The word"surpassed"indicates that Amina's performance was better than expected. The opposite would imply that her performance did not meet expectations.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
These boys never act in public, so the police are now worried about their covert activities.
explanation:
covert means something that is not openly acknowledged or displayed.
"covert operations against the dictatorship"
synonyms:
secret·furtive
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
It is inconceivable that the rat devoured the cat.
explanation:
The word"inconceivable"means something impossible to imagine or believe. Therefore, the opposite would be something believable orcredible.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
In the latter part of his life, the famous soldier showed signs of youthfulness.
explanation:
The word"youthfulness"suggests qualities associated with being young, such as energy and vitality. The opposite would imply signs of ageing or deterioration.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
Some equatorial areas have a sultry climate.
explanation:
The word"sultry"refers to a hot and humid climate, often implying discomfort due to the heat.
The opposite of this would be"temperate,"which describes a mild or moderate climate.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
There is much apathy towards reading among students nowadays.
explanation:
The opposite of"apathy"(which means a lack of interest, enthusiasm or concern) is"enthusiasm".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
Updating the Board's brochure is an arduous task.
explanation:
The word "arduous" means requiring a lot of effort and hard work, often involving difficult or strenuous tasks. The opposite of "arduous" is something that is easy, requiring little effort or difficulty.
Option A, "an easy," is the choice that expresses the opposite meaning. So, the sentence with this option would convey that updating the Board's brochure is a task that is not difficult or demanding.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).
All wondered why the principal was ambivalent about the students' future.
explanation:
The opposite of"ambivalent"(which means having mixed or conflicting feelings) is"decisive"(meaning having the ability to make decisions quickly and firmly).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

explanation:

text:
The word in capital letters has an emphatic stress. Choose the option that best fits the expression in the sentence.
YOUR sister should come with us tomorrow.

options.A: Should your brother come with us tomorrow?
options.B: Should our brother come with us tomorrow?
options.C: Should Ado come with us tomorrow?
options.D: Should my sister come with us tomorrow?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or syllable in a sentence or utterance. The rule is to select a question from the options that is similar to the sentence above except for the word in capital letters. Option D is the answer to this question because the sentence is the appropriate response to the question as it aims to clarify the misapprehension in the question. It is not my sister but rather, YOUR sister that should come with us tomorrow.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has an emphatic stress. Choose the option that best fits the expression in the sentence.
My neighbour BRUISED his thigh while playing football.

options.A: Did your neighbour break his leg while playing tennis?
options.B: Did your neighbour fracture his thigh while playing football?
options.C: Was your neighbour involved in an accident ?
options.D: Did your neighbour play football yesterday?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or syllable in a sentence or utterance. The rule is to select a question from the options that is similar to the sentence above except for the word in capital letters. Option B is the answer to this question because the sentence is the appropriate response to the question as it aims to clarify the misapprehension that the neighbour "fractured" his thigh while playing football.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The word in capital letters has an emphatic stress. Choose the option that best fits the expression in the sentence.
They FLEW to Abuja.

options.A: Did they go to Abuja by road?
options.C: How will they get to Abuja?

explanation:
Emphatic stress is the placement of greater stress on a particular word or phrase in a sentence or expression in order to highlight its importance, contrast or to express a strong feeling or affirmation. This stress changes the meaning of the sentence or draws attention to the information emphasised. In emphatic stress questions, the goal is to find the question that the expression is trying to correct. The word in capital letters is stressed to correct a mistake made in the question. Therefore, the option that has a word different from the one in capital letters should be the correct answer.
In the sentence, "They FLEW to Abuja," the question that best fits is "Did they go to Abuja by road?"
It shows that the responder to the question is trying to correct the fact that they did not go by road but FLEW to Abuja.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
I do not think any sane person would have acted in such a ....... manner.
explanation:
The sentence suggests that the person acted in a manner that is unreasonable or harsh. "Cruel" fits this context, as it describes someone who would behave in a way that causes harm or suffering.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Neither Agbo nor his parents ...... the meetings now.
explanation:
The subject of the sentence is "Neither Agbo nor his parents". In this case, the use of the compound conjunction "neither...or" requires that the verb that follows this should agree with the noun nearest to it which is "his parents." Therefore, the plural verb "attend" should be used. Also, the use of the word "now" to suggest that the event or situation being described is in the present, so it is imperative that a verb in the present tense be used.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Modern dancing has become rather scientific and so requires .......
explanation:
The sentence discusses modern dancing and how it has become more scientific. The phrase "requires..." should logically be followed by something that reflects the skill or expertise needed for modern dancing. "Choreographic skill" refers to the ability to create and arrange dance movements which is more related to dancing than any other option.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Had he considered his public image carefully, he ..... from his office in the election.
explanation:
The most appropriate option to fill the gap isB. would have stepped down. The sentence is in the modal form, which is used to talk about hypothetical situations in the past. The correct form is “If + past perfect, would + have + past participle”. In this case, the correct sentence would be “If he had considered his public image carefully, he would have stepped down from his office in the election”.
The terms “step down” and “stand down” are interchangeable and can be used to indicate the act of resigning from a position or office. However, “step down” is more commonly used when discussing political positions or offices. In the sentence “Had he considered his public image carefully, he would have stepped down from his office in the election,” the phrase “would have stepped down” is used to indicate that the person would have resigned from their position if they had considered their public image more carefully.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The government which .....recruiting ....... workers suddenly stopped doing so.
explanation:
The subject "government" is singular, so the verb should be"was"(singular form). The possessive pronoun "its" correctly refers back to the singular noun "government" and indicates ownership of the workers being recruited.
Thus, the sentence should read: "The government whichwasrecruitingitsworkers suddenly stopped doing so."
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Of course, we all saw the culprit ....... and hit the man on the head.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
Of course, we all saw the culprit approach and hit the man on the head.
The verb to fill in the gap should model the verb "hit" in the other part of the compound structure.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
A child that shows mature characteristics at an early age may be described as .......
explanation:
Aprecociouschild exhibits mature qualities, abilities or behaviour at an unusually early age. It describes children who show advanced skills or intelligence before their peers.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The company Director showed the contractor a ....... of the proposed office complex.
explanation:
Aprototypeis an early model or sample of something, used to demonstrate the design or concept of a project. In the context of a proposed office complex, the director would likely show the contractor aprototypeto illustrate the design or structure before construction begins.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
....... you come early to the new house, clean up my flat.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"Should you come early to the new house, clean up my flat."
This is an example of a conditional sentence, where"should"is used to form a more formal or inverted condition (similar to "if you come early").
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
This imposing edifice ....... a fortune to build.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"This imposing edifice cost a fortune to build."
Costis the correct past tense of "cost".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
They let him go in ....... to his age.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"They let him go in respect to his age."
Respectmeans consideration or honour due to a person's age. "in respect to" is the common expression.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Some scientists are trying to ...... human beings in their laboratories.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"Some scientists are trying to replicate human beings in their laboratories."
Replicatemeans to make an exact copy or reproduce. It means that scientists trying to recreate or reproduce human beings.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
He does not seem to know how to solve the problem ...... ?
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"He does not seem to know how to solve the problem, does he?"
"Does he"forms the correct question tag for a negative statement ("He does notseem to..."), where we use a positive tag after a negative statement for contrast or confirmation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
These villagers ....... to grow rice.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"These villagers used to grow rice."
Used toshows an action or situation that was true in the past but is no longer the case. The villagers grew rice in the past but no longer do.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Ade tried to ...... all memory of his dead father.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"Ade tried to obliterate all memory of his dead father."
Obliteratemeans to completely erase or destroy.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The weather is probably ..... appealing for people who live in Jos ..... for foreigners.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"The weather is probably less appealing for people who live in Jos than for foreigners."
Less ... thanis the appropriate comparative structure to show that the weather may not be as appealing to locals as it is to foreigners.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The meeting was called to ...... divergent views on the subject of a national conference.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"The meeting was called to reconcile divergent views on the subject of a national conference."
Reconcilemeans to bring together differing opinions or settle disagreements, which is appropriate here as the purpose of the meeting is to harmonise or address the different views on the topic.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The police came early enough to...... the bomb planted by the rioters.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"The police came early enough to defuse the bomb planted by the rioters."
Defusemeans to make a situation less dangerous or to deactivate an explosive device.Diffusemeans to spread over a wide area.Insulatemeans to protect from heat, cold or noise.Detonatemeans to set off an explosion, which is the opposite of what the police aim to do in this situation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
..... told of his impending arrival, I worked hard to make his short stay very comfortable.
explanation:
The sentence should read:
"Having been told of his impending arrival, I worked hard to make his short stay very comfortable."
Having beenis the correct form here because it introduces an action that occurred prior to the main action ("I worked hard"). It indicates that the speaker was informed beforehand, which led them to prepare for the arrival.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
More ...... to your elbow as you campaign for press freedom.
explanation:
More power to your elbow is  an expression of praise or admiration for someone's success or brave actions:
More grease to your elbow is informal and a colloquial slang
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
When Ajike met her ..... husband at the party, she felt like reconciling with him.
explanation:
Estrangedmeans being emotionally distant or separated. In the context of the sentence, it means that Ajike had been distant from her husband, and meeting him at the party made her feel like reconciling with him.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
They had to ...... the generator when the electricity failed.
explanation:
To "fall back on" something means to use something as a last option when other plans or resources have failed or are unavailable. It means that something is already in place or available as a backup.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
The editor was not happy that the Nigerian press was hemmed .......
explanation:
The phrase "hemmed in" is a phrasal verb. To hem someone in means to prevent someone from moving or doing what they want to do. So the sentence would read:
The editor was not happy that the Nigerian press was hemmedin.
This means that the Nigerian press is not allowed to do what it wants to do.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
Three-quarters of the hostel ........ been painted and three-quarters of the students ...... moved in.
explanation:
Have is the root verb and is used alongside the pronoun I / You / We / Ye and They and plural noun. Generally, have is a present tense word. Has is used alongside the PRONOUNS He / She / It and Who and SINGULAR NOUNS.
Three-quarters of the hostel is a singular noun because it refers to a part of one object. Three-quarters of the students is a plural noun because it refers to more than one student.
Hence the sentence would read;Three-quarters of the hostel has been painted and three-quarters of the studentshavemoved in.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided. 
A wide range of options ....... made available to the political parties during the recently concluded elections.
explanation:
The sentence should read: "A wide range of options was made available to the political parties during the recently concluded elections." This maintains subject-verb agreement because "was" is the singular past tense form of "to be," which matches the singular subject "a wide range of options."
